content:
• Friday, December 9, 2011
  • STJ

    Deutsche Bank says stock up on shares of St. Jude Medical (STJ -1.6%) on weakness resulting from...

    Deutsche Bank says stock up on shares of St. Jude Medical (STJ -1.6%) on weakness resulting from yesterday's FDA panel vote against a heart sensor. DB is among those surprised by the vote despite successful study data, but notes STJ has plenty in its pipeline, including three recently approved products and perhaps two more by the end of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • WRK

    R.W. Baird calls MeadWestvaco (MWV +3.3%) an "under-appreciated franchise" in the packaging...

    R.W. Baird calls MeadWestvaco (MWV +3.3%) an "under-appreciated franchise" in the packaging sector and starts coverage at Outperform with a $36 target. MWV is "focused on shareholder value creation by selectively monetizing assets and increased consistency in free cash flow allocation," Baird says, noting the pending divestiture of its consumer office products business.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • OLED

    Shares of Universal Panel (PANL +4.3%) jump after a Goldman analyst suggests the developer of...

    Shares of Universal Panel (PANL +4.3%) jump after a Goldman analyst suggests the developer of organic light-emitting diode technology could benefit if Panasonic (PC) ramps up capacity at an OLED-panel manufacturing facility during the first half of 2012. PC and PANL currently have an existing commercial licensing agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • SIGA

    Siga Technologies (SIGA +29%) rallies a day after a board member responds to allegations of...

    Siga Technologies (SIGA +29%) rallies a day after a board member responds to allegations of unfair practices in the awarding of a multi-billion dollar government contract to the pharmaceutical company, saying the contract was given in a competitive process but its rival did not meet the requirements at the time of the contract award.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • QRTEA

    Shares of HSNI trade 6.6% higher after the firm is named to replace AGL Resources (AGL +1.4%) in...

    Shares of HSNI trade 6.6% higher after the firm is named to replace AGL Resources (AGL +1.4%) in the S&P 400 Midcap Index.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • SKYW

    SkyWest (SKYW +4.7%) gains after reporting late yesterday a 15.9 percent increase in revenue...

    SkyWest (SKYW +4.7%) gains after reporting late yesterday a 15.9 percent increase in revenue passenger miles for November, while available seat miles increased 14.3% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • ACCO

    Office products manufacturer ACCO Brands (ABD +5%) trades higher after KeyBanc initiates the...

    Office products manufacturer ACCO Brands (ABD +5%) trades higher after KeyBanc initiates the shares with a Buy, saying that valuations are compelling even without factoring in the synergies from its merger with MeadWestvaco.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.3%) and Starbucks (SBUX +2.3%) trade up on positive comments out...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +4.3%) and Starbucks (SBUX +2.3%) trade up on positive comments out of William Blair, saying K-Cup sales at Starbucks appear to be stronger than initially expected. Checks indicate the company sold about $4M worth of the single-serving product last month alone, without any promotional or marketing support.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • HSC

    Harsco (HSC +2.1%) reaffirms its earnings guidance for FY12, saying it expects earnings from...

    Harsco (HSC +2.1%) reaffirms its earnings guidance for FY12, saying it expects earnings from continuing operations of $1.55 - $1.70 per share, excluding restructuring charges, which is below analysts' EPS estimates of $1.74.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • COO

    Shares of Cooper Companies (COO +10.4%) post a double-digit gain after knocking out a...

    Shares of Cooper Companies (COO +10.4%) post a double-digit gain after knocking out a significant FQ4 earnings beat. CEO says in an earnings CC that the firm expects to see 6% growth in 2012 - falling in the midpoint of its guidance range. He also tips off the company expanded its salesforce by 25% as it looks to cover a greater geographic area.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • ENR

    Energizer Holdings (ENR +1.9%) announces that its president and CEO Joe McClanathan will retire...

    Energizer Holdings (ENR +1.9%) announces that its president and CEO Joe McClanathan will retire in the first half of 2012. The company appoints Alan Hoskins as McClanathan's successor.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • POM

    Pepco Holdings (POM +1.8%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform at Credit Suisse. The firm says...

    Pepco Holdings (POM +1.8%) moves up on an upgrade to Outperform at Credit Suisse. The firm says the company is uniquely positioned relative to most utilities to structurally improve its earned ROEs over coming years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • DO

    Diamond Offshore Drilling (DO +1.7%) trades higher despite being downgraded to Neutral at...

    Diamond Offshore Drilling (DO +1.7%) trades higher despite being downgraded to Neutral at Citigroup, citing less upside potential from rig re-pricings and new builds.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • FGP

    Propane distributor Ferrellgas Partners LP's (FGP -1.5%) falls after its FQ1 beat on revenue but...

    Propane distributor Ferrellgas Partners LP's (FGP -1.5%) falls after its FQ1 beat on revenue but came up far short on a per share basis. Losses widened as litigation expenses and higher propane and gas costs continue to weaken margins and cut into profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • RIG

    Accusing Transocean (RIG -2.8%) of "willful misconduct," the Justice Department asks the New...

    Accusing Transocean (RIG -2.8%) of "willful misconduct," the Justice Department asks the New Orleans district court to deny the oil drilling contractor's request to protect itself against civil penalties stemming from last year's Gulf of Mexico spill. The move suggests the U.S. government will seek the maximum possible penalties against RIG and possibly against BP.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 10 Comments
  • WM

    Waste Management (WM +2.2%) announces plans to boost its quarterly dividend by 4.4%, making it...

    Waste Management (WM +2.2%) announces plans to boost its quarterly dividend by 4.4%, making it the eighth straight year the nation's largest trash hauler and landfill operator has boosted its shareholder payout.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • PLL-OLD

    Shares of filter-maker Pall (PLL-OLD +9.3%) rush to the top of the S&P leader board after...

    Shares of filter-maker Pall (PLL-OLD +9.3%) rush to the top of the S&P leader board after reporting better-than-expected adjusted earnings and a 16.5% jump in quarterly revenue. Pall has been cutting costs, with $32.6M in restructuring expenses during the quarter; the company says it has made "substantial progress" on those initiatives.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD -5%) is by far the Dow's biggest decliner after the chemical maker cut its Q4 and...

    DuPont (DD -5%) is by far the Dow's biggest decliner after the chemical maker cut its Q4 and full-year outlook, citing slower growth and “global economic uncertainty.” Earnings season doesn’t ramp up for at least another month, but early indications aren’t pretty (see also: I, II); as Europe’s crisis grows, the resiliency of corporate America will be tested.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • LTM

    South American carrier Lan Airlines (LFL +2.1%) gains after reporting strong November passenger...

    South American carrier Lan Airlines (LFL +2.1%) gains after reporting strong November passenger statistics. Traffic increased 13.4% on a 15.1% rise in capacity, while its load factor decreased 1.3 points to 80.3%, with about 65.6% of total passenger traffic coming from international passengers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • BRFS

    BRF Brasil Foods (BRFS +2.7%), Brazil's largest food processor, agrees to swap assets with rival...

    BRF Brasil Foods (BRFS +2.7%), Brazil's largest food processor, agrees to swap assets with rival Marfrig (OTCPK:MRRTY +5.2%) as part of an agreement with antitrust regulators to sell some assets in order to go ahead with the full merger of the companies. The company was ordered to get rid of or suspend about 12% of production capacity in order to create a rival that could effectively compete with the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • LVS

    Nevada gaming revenue rose 8.1% to $960M in October, as Las Vegas casinos posted 13.3% gains to...

    Nevada gaming revenue rose 8.1% to $960M in October, as Las Vegas casinos posted 13.3% gains to $560M, the Nevada Gaming Control Board reports (.pdf). Slot revenue rose 5.4%, and table game revenue jumped 20.9% (excluding baccarat). LVS +2.1%, MGM +1.8%, WYNN +0.6%, BYD +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PEIX

    Renewable fuels marketer Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -7%) dips after announcing an $8M private...

    Renewable fuels marketer Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -7%) dips after announcing an $8M private placement with a group of institutional investors. Separately, the company also says it will acquire an additional 7% interest in Pacifi Ethanol's production facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • GEOS

    Shares of OYO Geospace (OYOG -10%) are getting hammered after its FQ4 results fall wide of the...

    Shares of OYO Geospace (OYOG -10%) are getting hammered after its FQ4 results fall wide of the mark. Both sales and Y/Y profit suffered from reduced shipments of its seismic products, but the company added that it expects levels to improve during the first half of 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • ONCY

    Oncolytics Biotech (ONCY +3.2%) says interim data from Phase 2 clinical trials using intravenous...

    Oncolytics Biotech (ONCY +3.2%) says interim data from Phase 2 clinical trials using intravenous administration of Reolysin in combination with Gemzar in patients with advanced pancreatic cancer was successful in reaching its primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +5.5%) gets a boost from Bernstein's Pierre Ferragu's breakup call. He says...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +5.5%) gets a boost from Bernstein's Pierre Ferragu's breakup call. He says there is no immediate bankruptcy risk and the liquidation value is above his price target of $2.67 (current price $1.64). "Keeping the company as it stands today doesn't serve anyone's interest ... the 'one stop shopping' model that drove the merger of Alcatel and Lucent is a complete failure."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD +2.9%) gets a boost after Deutsche initiates the shares with a Hold rating,...

    SandRidge Energy (SD +2.9%) gets a boost after Deutsche initiates the shares with a Hold rating, saying its new Mississippian disclosures could be a significant growth catalyst.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • IGTE

    iGate (IGTE +3.5%) gains after RBC initiates coverage with an Outperform rating, noting the...

    iGate (IGTE +3.5%) gains after RBC initiates coverage with an Outperform rating, noting the potential for 25% annualized EPS growth over the next few years, even assuming a depressed budgeting environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • DMND

    Embattled food packager Diamond Foods (DMND +34%) explodes higher after KeyBanc says the...

    Embattled food packager Diamond Foods (DMND +34%) explodes higher after KeyBanc says the accounting scandal will fade and the sale of Pringles to P&G (NYSE:PG) will go through. The firm gives the shares a buy rating, though lowering its price target to $76 from $95 due to the recent sharp decline. (the saga)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    WSJ reports Nokia (NOK +2.4%) will jump back into the U.S. cellular market next week with an...

    WSJ reports Nokia (NOK +2.4%) will jump back into the U.S. cellular market next week with an announcement that T-Mobile (OTCQX:DTEGY) will carry Nokia’s Lumia 710 smartphone running Windows Phone 7 (NASDAQ:MSFT) software, confirming an earlier report. RIMM's stumbles have provided a window of opportunity for NOK, but the launch likely will be dubbed a failure if early sales are slow.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • FIO

    The catalysts behind the decline (22% in a month) in Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) shares - expiration of...

    The catalysts behind the decline (22% in a month) in Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) shares - expiration of insider lockups and misguided analyst commentary - will soon fade, writes Tech Insidr. Saying FIO is going to lose Facebook business to competitors (NASDAQ:OCZ) is like "suggesting KIA is going to steal market share from BMW ... they make completely different products for completely different customers."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC +3.5%) says it's buying back up to $70 million of its Class A common shares to...

    GNC Holdings (GNC +3.5%) says it's buying back up to $70 million of its Class A common shares to mitigate dilution from employees redeeming their stock options.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTL

    Mechel Steel (MTL +2.6%) says work at several facilities in two of its Southern Kuzbass coal...

    Mechel Steel (MTL +2.6%) says work at several facilities in two of its Southern Kuzbass coal mines has been fully resumed after a temporary suspension, enabling the company to produce at full capacity once again.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • TXN

    At least seven brokerages cut price targets on Texas Instruments (TXN -2.2%) after the chipmaker...

    At least seven brokerages cut price targets on Texas Instruments (TXN -2.2%) after the chipmaker cut its outlook for the current quarter and warned of lower demand as customers reduce inventories. Declines in TI's product lines have been larger than expected due to macro issues including flooding in Thailand, although its OMAP application processor is seen as a bright spot.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • BCSI

    In the wake of the Blue Coat Systems (BCSI +44%)-Thoma Bravo deal, rivals Riverbed Technologies...

    In the wake of the Blue Coat Systems (BCSI +44%)-Thoma Bravo deal, rivals Riverbed Technologies (RVBD +4.4%) and Websense (WBSN +6.6%) are catching speculative bids.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • SIRI

    Coverage of Sirius XM (SIRI +2.3%) is launched at Citigroup with a Buy rating and $2.20 price...

    Coverage of Sirius XM (SIRI +2.3%) is launched at Citigroup with a Buy rating and $2.20 price target, reflecting "healthy" subscriber growth, high operating leverage, solid free cash growth and "potential equity shrink" starting in the 2012 second half. Citi sees "many years" of subscriber growth ahead, with a terminal user base of ~34M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPPI

    Shares of Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -10.1%) fall after the FDA notes an unidentified...

    Shares of Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -10.1%) fall after the FDA notes an unidentified company has applied to sell generic copies of Suilev. Also adding to sentiment, the firm's CEO is taking on a barrage of criticism over a lush stock award for 2011 of potentially as many as 2.87M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • DDC

    Harry Winston (HWD +3.1%) reverses and turns sharply higher despite posting Q3 earnings...

    Harry Winston (HWD +3.1%) reverses and turns sharply higher despite posting Q3 earnings (adjusted for one-time items) of $0.04, missing expectations of $0.09. Revenue dropped to $119.7M vs. $140.9M a year ago as rough diamond sales sunk 40%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC -3.6%) warns that current-quarter revenue will decline more than...

    Lattice Semiconductor (LSCC -3.6%) warns that current-quarter revenue will decline more than previously forecast, citing a further weakening of demand in its communications business. The maker of programmable logic chips now sees Q4 revenue down 14%-17% sequentially; previous guidance was for a 4%-9% drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • TITN

    Shares of Titan Machinery (TITN +8.1%) rally after the retailer of construction and agricultural...

    Shares of Titan Machinery (TITN +8.1%) rally after the retailer of construction and agricultural equipment says FQ3 earnings rose 66% as margins enjoyed a boost from its service and rental business. TITN also raised its full-year earnings estimate and revenue forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (NASDAQ:PCYC) will collaborate with a JNJ subsidiary to develop and commercialize...

    Pharmacyclics (NASDAQ:PCYC) will collaborate with a JNJ subsidiary to develop and commercialize an oral treatment of non-Hodgkins lymphoma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia and multiple myeloma. But RBC Capital cuts its recommendation, noting near-term upside may be limited in 2012 given the vastly reduced probability that PCYC will be acquired. PCYC -8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) down 6.3% premarket to $55 as small Imperial Capital suggests it could be...

    Sears Holdings (SHLD) down 6.3% premarket to $55 as small Imperial Capital suggests it could be worth $6... or even negative equity. The retailer's weak results may be overstated by pension funding costs, and competitition is heating up; Imperial puts a Sell rating on long-dated senior notes and Underperform on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • BCSI

    Premarket gainers: BCSI +44%. BCS +4%. CPST +4%. LYG +4%. DB +4%. AG +4%. ALU +3%. SIRI +3%. MT...

    Premarket gainers: BCSI +44%. BCS +4%. CPST +4%. LYG +4%. DB +4%. AG +4%. ALU +3%. SIRI +3%. MT +3%. CMVT +3%.
    Losers: CTIC -15%. IVR -10%. LSCC -7%. PCYC -7%. AMR -7%. TXN -6%. DD -6%. ALTR -5%. STJ -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ESL

    Shares of Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL) trade 1% higher premarket after Wells Fargo fires up...

    Shares of Esterline Technologies (NYSE:ESL) trade 1% higher premarket after Wells Fargo fires up an upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform. Though analysts with the firm lower their FY12 EPS estimate to $5.20 from $5.60, they say the risk/reward tradeoff for ESL is more favorable now.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • TOT

    French energy concern Total (NYSE:TOT) plans to kick in $800M to increase its stake in Russian...

    French energy concern Total (NYSE:TOT) plans to kick in $800M to increase its stake in Russian indie gas producer Novatek. The move is part of a sweeping plan by Total to increase its interest in Novatek to 19.4% within 3 years and tap into the world's largest gas reserves. Shares of TOT +1.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (NYSE:STJ) -2.3% premarket after an FDA panel votes not to recommend its...

    St. Jude Medical (NYSE:STJ) -2.3% premarket after an FDA panel votes not to recommend its CardioMEMS implantable heart device for treating heart failure. Six of 10 members said they could not determine whether the potential benefits of the wireless pressure sensor and its supporting computer monitors outweighed potential risks.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM
  • IVR

    Shares of Invesco Mortgage Capital (NYSE:IVR) lose 8.6% premarket after the firm takes on a...

    Shares of Invesco Mortgage Capital (NYSE:IVR) lose 8.6% premarket after the firm takes on a downgrade from FBR Capital to Market Perform from Outperform with a reduced price target of $16. Yesterday, Invesco trimmed its dividend to $0.65/share from $0.80/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD) cuts its 2011 outlook, "seeing slower growth in certain segments during the 4th...

    DuPont (DD) cuts its 2011 outlook, "seeing slower growth in certain segments during the 4th quarter, driven by global economic uncertainty. This uncertainty is contributing to ongoing conservative cash management in some supply chains." The company sees 2011 EPS of $3.87-$3.95 from $3.97-$4.05 previously. Shares -6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • GM

    Shares of General Motors (NYSE:GM) and Ford (NYSE:F) both tilt higher after rival Toyota...

    Shares of General Motors (NYSE:GM) and Ford (NYSE:F) both tilt higher after rival Toyota (NYSE:TM) cuts its FY12 outlook dramatically. Premarket: GM +1.5%, F +1.6%, TM -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTIC

    Shares of Cell Therepautics (NASDAQ:CTIC) lose 11.6% in premarket trading after the firm...

    Shares of Cell Therepautics (NASDAQ:CTIC) lose 11.6% in premarket trading after the firm announces that it entered an agreement where it will sell $20M of its Series 14 preferred shares and warrants in order to purchase common stock in a registered offering to 2 institutional investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 AM

  • European shares are at the day's highs following the news coming out of the EU summit. It's hard...

    European shares are at the day's highs following the news coming out of the EU summit. It's hard to believe anything contained in the draft is inspiring the move, but markets make opinions, says the man. Stoxx 50 +2.1%, Germany +2%. S&P futures +1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM | 11 Comments
